title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.1: SOCIAL POLICY AND PROTECTION

description.narrative: By 2024, National institutions use equity-based information to develop child-sensitive policies and programme., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Evaluation, Evaluation (Covid), Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children, especially the poorest, the most excluded and those affected by crisis, have access to child-sensitive and shock- responsive social services, benefit from positive community practices and are empowered to be agents of change within their communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, National institutions use equity-based information to develop child-sensitive policies and programme.

description.narrative: With the child poverty report, secondary analysis from MICS data, budget analysis briefs and the 2 newly completed evaluation in the education sector, DRC is provided with reliable evidence and strategic information to inform national, sectoral and provincial policies (data and analysis) as well the targeting of child related programmes. In addition, the modeling of shock responsive social safety nets at Nsele contributed to support 21,000 households with cash transfers for 9 months and to test Government social registry and MIS tools for the roll out of social safety nets | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
